top_categories.workout_context: Burnt Bridge Classic’s gravel roads, paved sections demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Burnt Bridge Classic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Burnt Bridge Classic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Burnt Bridge Classic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Burnt Bridge Classic. Make this intensity feel like home.
Burnt Bridge Classic’s mixed gravel and paved roads drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Burnt Bridge Classic’s mixed gravel and paved roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Burnt Bridge Classic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The varied gradients at Burnt Bridge Classic reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Burnt Bridge Classic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on mixed gravel and paved roads.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Burnt Bridge Classic — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Burnt Bridge Classic’s mixed gravel and paved roads delivers on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Burnt Bridge Classic’s 62 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Burnt Bridge Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on mixed gravel and paved roads to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, paved sections, wine country terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 62 miles of mixed gravel and paved roads in Cowichan Valley, British Columbia.
